column1: #Text=Protesters arrested at anti-Scientology event in Atlanta

#Text=While protesting outside the Scientology Church of Georgia in Atlanta , Georgia , United States , two members of the group Anonymous were arrested by DeKalb County riot police while standing opposite the Church of Scientology -owned building .

#Text=The two protesters , who earlier participated in the delivery of a ' global speech ' collaboratively written and read by members of Anonymous at protests worldwide , are believed to have been charged by Dekalb police for protesting without a permit and causing ' offensive or hazardous conditions ' .
#Text=However , other members of Anonymous who took leading roles in arranging the protest are adamant that the Dekalb police had previously told them they did not need a permit to protest .
#Text=The arrests were filmed by other members of Anonymous who subsequently posted the videos onto popular video-sharing website YouTube .

#Text=The videos show a very quick arrest in which the arresting officers did not read the Miranda rights of the protesters , which — contrary to popular belief — is only required to be read before a police officer interviews someone in custody .
#Text=This was confirmed by other members of the group who say they did n't hear their rights being read before they were led away . "

#Text=When , after the arrests were made , the police started to adopt the policy of ticketing drivers who honked , members of Anonymous quickly raised  Do not honk " signs to drivers .

column1: #Text=Both of the members of Anonymous have been released , one with a bail of $ 763.00 .
#Text=There are confirmed to be two charges standing against one .
#Text=No information has been released from the police department at this point .
#Text=They did no wrong , and that building they were led into was reportedly the Scientology Org building . — Kalira , Doomfeller blog
#Text=Initial reaction from bloggers was generally critical of the arrests .
